columns.text: In this exercise, we are to determine the amount of external financing necessary for the financial plan.

## Financial Planning
\
Financial planning is referred to as the systematic method of the attainment of the company's financial goals. It indicates the actions and decisions to be done in the future for the company.

## Pro Forma Statements
\
Pro Forma statements include a forecasted balance sheet, an income statement, and a statement of cash flows. These financial statements are necessary for the determination of the summary of projected events in the succeeding years of operation of the firm.
\
The pro forma statements are considered outputs of the financial plan. The management would estimate the projected and would then produce the pro forma statements.

Now, let us determine the external financing needed using the following given:
 

<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Income Statement||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Sales|\$25,400|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Cost|\$17,300|
|$\hspace{30pt}$Taxable Income|\$8,100|
|$\hspace{30pt}$Tax Expenses|\$1,701|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Net Income|\$6,399|
|Balance Sheet||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Assets|\$61,000|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Debt|\$26,900|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Equity|\$34,100|

Now, let us prepare the pro forma income statement:
 
$$\textbf{Pro Forma}\\
\textbf{Income Statement}$$

$$\begin{array}{l r}
\text{Sales}&{\$29,210.00}\\
\text{Cost}&\underline{19,862.80}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Taxable Income}&{\$9,347.20}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Taxes}&\underline{1,962.91}\\
\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Net Income}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\textbf{7,384.29}}}\\
\end{array}$$

Now, let us prepare the pro forma balance sheet:
 
$$\textbf{Pro Forma}\\
\textbf{Balance Sheet}$$

$$\begin{array}{l r l r}
\text{Assets}&{\$70,104}&\text{Debt}&{\$26,900.00}\\
{}&{}&\text{Equity}&\underline{41,484.29}\\
\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Total }&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\hspace{6pt}\textbf{70,104}}}&\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Total }&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\textbf{68,384.29}}}\\
\end{array}$$

The total assets and the total debt and equity does not balance out based on the preceding computations. The increase in the equity which is the cash dividends and retained earnings is also not sufficient to balance the amounts in the balance sheet. Therefore, the company should provide additional external financing.
The exercise will require us to compute the EFN (external financing needed) for Cardinal Inc.

### Let's first provide the given data in the problem.

* Assets and costs are proportional to sales.
* Debt and equity are not proportionate to sales.
* Dividend of $2,100 was paid to the stockholders.
* The company wishes to maintain a pay-out ratio.
* The projected sales for next year are $29,210.00.

## Requirement.

### Compute the EFN (external financing needed) of Cardinal, Inc.

### Compute the taxable income.

The projected taxable income will be used in calculating a business tax.



$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Sales}&\$29,210.00\\
\text{Cost of Sales}&\underline{19,894.93}\\
\text{Taxable Income}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$9,315.07}}}\\


\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the taxable income is **$9,315.07**.

### Compute the projected net income using the Pro-forma income statement.

After computing the projected cost of sales and business tax, we can now calculate the projected net income.

The calculation is as follows.

$$
\begin{array}{c}
\textbf{Cardinal, Inc.}\\
\text{Pro Forma}\\
\text{Income Statement}
\end{array}
$$

$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Sales}&\$29,210.00\\
\text{Cost of Sales}&\underline{19,894.93}\\
\text{Taxable Income}&9,315.07\\
\text{Taxes(21\%)}&\underline{1,956.16}\\
\textbf{Net Income}&\underline{\underline{\$7,358.91}}

\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the projected net income is **$7,358.91**.

### Compute the projected retained earnings.


The projected retained earnings are calculated by deducting the projected dividend from the projected net income.

The calculation is as follows.



$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Net Income}&\$7,358.91\\
\text{Less: Projected Dividend }&\underline{(2,415.19)}\\
\textbf{Retained Earnings}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$4,943.72}}}\\

\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the projected retained earnings are **$7,358.91**.

### Compute the projected equity.

The projected equity is calculated by adding the equity balance with the projected retained earnings.


The calculation is as follows.



$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Equity}&\$34,100.00\\
\text{Projected Retained Earnings}&\underline{4,943.72}\\
\textbf{Projected Equity}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$39,043.72}}}\\

\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the projected equity is **$39,043.72**.

Note: The declared dividends are not included in the calculation of the projected equity as it is considered released to the company's stockholders. The retained earnings are added to the equity calculation as it is viewed as a reserve balance.

### Compute the projected assets.

Assets are to be projected in proportion to the increase in sales.

The formula is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Projected Assets}&= \text{Assets} \times \text{Percentage of increase in sales}\\[15pt]
&= \$61,000.00  \times 115\%\\[15pt]
&= \boxed{\textbf{\$70,150.00}}


\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the projected assets are **$70,150.00**.

### Compute the projected EFN (external financing needed).

Assets should be equal to liabilities and equity. Any difference is attributable to the EFN.

$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Assets}&\$70,150.00\\
\textbf{Less:}\\
\hspace{5pt}\text{Liabilities}&(26,900.00)\\
\hspace{5pt}\text{Projected Equity}&\underline{(39,043.72)}\\
\textbf{EFN}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$4,206.28}}}\\


\end{array}
$$
